intro: Trichopilia dasyandra, commonly known as the Woolly Pincushion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy, pinkish-white composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance. Trichopilia dasyandra is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
